stepAnswer: Each box plot is spread out more in the greater values. Each plot is skewed to the right, so the ages of the top 50% of buyers are more variable than the ages of the lower 50%.
stepTitle: Describe what the shape of each box plot implies about the distribution of the data collected for that car series.
choices: Each box plot is spread out more in the greater values. Each plot is skewed to the left, so the ages of the top 50% of buyers are less variable than the ages of the lower 50%.
Each box plot is spread out more in the greater values. Each plot is skewed to the right, so the ages of the top 50% of buyers are more variable than the ages of the lower 50%.
